div1.head: Letter from William L. Lazear to Charlotte C. Lazear, August 2, 1871
div1.p:
I have very little
to say and life time to say
it in --

Our dear boys were bright
as usual this morning --

Willie expected to go a
“travelin” this morning -- sons
hunting his “but with a
blue Card” -- had not fully
made up his mind to go to
Jordan or to the mountains
-- His Aunt Kate had been
recommending the Summit to
him -- Jesse expected
a busy to day of it walk the
picnic of the Good Tompsons
-- Harry Tombell called
to see me today -- He says
Ellen is very well-

Ma and Kate expect to
drive out to see them tomorrow
-- Uncle Borlings writes
from Uniontown that he and
Aunt Virginia have engaged
boarding near that place,
-- so that neither one of them
will probably be here this
summer.

-- I was disappointed that
I have no letter from you
today.
